Likelihood given  $( y = (y_1, \dots,y_n))$ :  
$$ P(\pi|y) = k(y) \cdot \prod_{i = 1}^{n} \pi^{y_i}(1-\pi)^{(1-y_i)}$$

Log Likelihood: $$ \ln P(\pi|y) \, \dot{=} \,  \sum_{i=1}^{n} y_i \ln(\pi) $$ 
$$ + \sum_{i=1}^{n} (1-y_i) \ln(1-\pi)$$
